en: Please get whatever you like.
zh: 请随便拿你喜欢的。

en: Jack of all trades, and master of none.
zh: 样样都懂，样样稀松。

en: You can't hope to have your own way in everything.
zh: 你不可能事事如意。

en: Without motivation, nothing can be achieved.
zh: 没有动力，一事无成。

en: It was nothing.
zh: 没什么。

en: I'll do anything.
zh: 我什么都愿意做。

en: Stop making a fuss over nothing.
zh: 别为一点小事大惊小怪。

en: You shall not have your own way in everything.
zh: 你不能事事都随心所欲。

en: Anything will do.
zh: 什么都行。

en: A jack of all trades is a master of none.
zh: 万事通，样样松。

en: Help yourself to anything you'd like to eat.
zh: 想吃什么就随便吃。

en: I am entirely at your service.
zh: 我完全听您吩咐。

en: I'm sure people would live twice as long if they stopped getting themselves worked up over everything.
zh: 我确信如果人们不再为一切事情烦恼，他们会活得两倍长。

en: Eat whatever you like.
zh: 想吃什么就吃什么。

en: What marvelous weather.
zh: 天气真好。

en: What's it made from?
zh: 这是什么做的？

en: Come again?
zh: 再说一遍？

en: I don't care what you say. It's not going to happen!
zh: 我不在乎你怎么说。这是不可能发生的！

en: Holy cow!
zh: 我的天啊！

en: The men will be happy if they get anything back.
zh: 如果他们能拿回任何东西，男人们都会很高兴。

en: I didn't hear what you said.
zh: 我没听清你说什么。

en: What's my book doing here?
zh: 我的书怎么会在这里？

en: What an ambiguous expression!
zh: 多么模棱两可的表达啊！

en: I'm sort of tired.
zh: 我有点累。

en: We'll what?
zh: 我们怎么样？

en: School begins the day after tomorrow.
zh: 后天开学。

en: Schools are expected to meet the needs of every child, regardless of ability.
zh: 学校应该满足每个孩子的需求，无论能力如何。

en: Our school begins at eight in the morning.
zh: 我们学校早上八点开始上课。

en: Is the school on this side of the river?
zh: 学校是在河的这边吗？

en: The school adopted the new method of teaching English.
zh: 学校采用了新的英语教学方法。

en: Our school was reduced to ashes.
zh: 我们的学校被烧成灰烬。

en: School begins in spring.
zh: 学校在春天开学。

en: They announced an increase in tuition fees.
zh: 他们宣布增加学费。

en: The school is within walking distance of my house.
zh: 学校离我家很近，步行可达。

en: School begins on April the tenth.
zh: 学校四月十号开学。

en: School begins in April.
zh: 学校在四月开学。

en: School starts next Monday.
zh: 下周一开学。

en: School begins at 8:10 a.m.
zh: 学校早上八点十分开始上课。

en: The school is situated in healthy surroundings.
zh: 学校坐落在健康的环境中。

en: School will open on Monday.
zh: 学校将于星期一开学。

en: School begins at nine.
zh: 学校九点开始上课。

en: School reopens in September.
zh: 学校九月重新开学。

en: You shouldn't go to school.
zh: 你不应该去学校。

en: Our school is within ten minutes' walk of my house.
zh: 我们的学校离我家步行十分钟之内。

en: Is your school far from your home?
zh: 你的学校离你家远吗？

en: What time does school begin?
zh: 学校几点开始上课？

en: School will break for the summer.
zh: 学校要放暑假了。

en: The school is farther than the station.
zh: 学校比车站远。

en: The school is located within five minutes' walk of the station.
zh: 学校位于离车站步行五分钟之内的地方。

en: The school awarded Mary a prize.
zh: 学校授予了玛丽一个奖项。

en: While we were on holiday, a neighbor took care of our cat.
zh: 我们度假的时候，邻居帮我们照顾了猫。

en: Let's take advantage of the vacation to mow the lawn.
zh: 咱们趁着放假把草坪修剪一下吧。

en: The number of students who travel abroad for vacation is increasing.
zh: 出国度假的学生人数正在增加。

en: Let's take advantage of the vacation to go on a hike.
zh: 咱们趁着放假去徒步旅行吧。

en: Please cut short your vacation and return.
zh: 请缩短假期并返回。

en: If you don't take a vacation, you'll collapse.
zh: 如果你不休假，你会垮掉的。

en: Enjoy your vacation.
zh: 祝你假期愉快。

en: It's costing me a lot to spend the holidays.
zh: 过节花了我很多钱。

en: We argued with each other about the best place for a holiday.
zh: 我们为了去哪里度假争论不休。

en: How did you spend your vacation?
zh: 你假期是怎么过的？

en: Where do you suppose you'll spend your vacation?
zh: 你打算去哪里度假？

en: Can you extend your holiday by a few days?
zh: 你能把假期延长几天吗？

en: Make the most of your vacation.
zh: 好好享受你的假期。

en: The vacation is close to an end.
zh: 假期快要结束了。

en: The holidays came to an end at last.
zh: 假期终于结束了。

en: We have five days to go before the holidays.
zh: 离放假还有五天。

en: The holidays seem to be doing her health good.
zh: 假期似乎对她的健康有益。

en: We must make the most of our vacation, as it is so short.
zh: 我们必须充分利用我们的假期，因为它太短了。

en: I'll be only too pleased to help you.
zh: 我很乐意帮助你。

en: Where are you going on vacation?
zh: 你打算去哪里度假？

en: How was your vacation?
zh: 你的假期怎么样？

en: The holidays always end all too soon.
zh: 假期总是结束得太快。

en: How did you enjoy your vacation?
zh: 你假期过得怎么样？

en: The holidays ended all too soon.
zh: 假期结束得太快了。

en: The holiday ended all too soon.
zh: 假期结束得太快了。

en: Can you keep a secret?
zh: 你能保守秘密吗？

en: Since you look tired, you had better take a rest.
zh: 既然你看起来很累，你最好休息一下。

en: Now that you are tired, you'd better rest.
zh: 既然你累了，你最好休息一下。

en: You are tired, and so am I.
zh: 你很累，我也是。

en: You are tired, aren't you?
zh: 你很累，不是吗？

en: Are you not tired?
zh: 你不累吗？

en: You look tired. You ought to rest for an hour or two.
zh: 你看上去很累。你应该休息一两个小时。

en: You are too sensitive to criticism.
zh: 你对批评太敏感了。

en: You can rely on him.
zh: 你可以依靠他。

en: You can rely on her.
zh: 你可以依靠她。

en: You must help her, and soon!
zh: 你必须帮助她，而且要快！

en: You must not take advantage of her innocence.
zh: 你绝不能利用她的天真。

en: You should have acted on her advice.
zh: 你应该听从她的建议。

en: You are treading on her corns.
zh: 你踩到她的痛处了。

en: I think that you ought to apologize to her.
zh: 我认为你应该向她道歉。

en: You must apologize to her, and that at once.
zh: 你必须向她道歉，而且要立刻道歉。

en: Just a minute.
zh: 等一下。

en: You asked after her? What did she say?
zh: 你问起她了？她说了什么？

en: You are expecting too much of her.
zh: 你对她期望太高了。

en: Did you meet her?
zh: 你见到她了吗？

en: Do you want to see her very much?
zh: 你很想见到她吗？

en: Did you fall in love with her at first sight?
zh: 你对她一见钟情了吗？

en: You were taken in by her.
zh: 你被她骗了。

en: You told her that you had finished the work three days before.
zh: 你告诉她你三天前就完成了工作。

en: Unlike her, you are diligent.
zh: 和你不同，你很勤奋。

en: A fire broke out in the neighborhood yesterday.
zh: 昨天附近街区发生了火灾。

en: There has been another case of cholera in the neighborhood.
zh: 附近街区又出现了一例霍乱病例。

en: I haven't slept well recently.
zh: 我最近睡得不好。

en: I have seen little of him of late.
zh: 我近来很少见到他。

en: I have seen much of him lately.
zh: 我最近经常见到他。

en: The number of Japanese students returning after life abroad has been increasing as of late.
zh: 近年来，从国外生活归来的日本学生人数一直在增加。

en: Young people wear their hair long these days.
zh: 现在年轻人喜欢留长发。

en: The sudden increase of cars is causing a large number of traffic accidents every day.
zh: 最近汽车数量的突然增加导致每天发生大量的交通事故。

en: Nowadays we are apt to forget the benefits of nature.
zh: 现在我们很容易忘记大自然的好处。

en: Beef is expensive nowadays.
zh: 现在牛肉很贵。

en: These days more and more people are traveling abroad.
zh: 现在越来越多的人出国旅行。

en: Travelling is easy these days.
zh: 现在旅行很方便。

en: The recent frequency of earthquakes makes us nervous.
zh: 最近地震频繁发生，这让我们感到紧张。

en: Honesty seems to be rather at a discount today.
zh: 如今，诚实似乎不太值钱了。

en: Nowadays jobs are hard to come by.
zh: 现在工作很难找。

en: Few people visit me these days.
zh: 现在很少有人来看我。

en: Many young Japanese travel overseas these days.
zh: 现在很多日本年轻人出国旅行。

en: Business is so slow these days.
zh: 最近生意很清淡。

en: Good lumber is hard to find these days.
zh: 现在很难找到优质木材。

en: Many shoes nowadays are made of plastics.
zh: 现在很多鞋子都是用塑料制成的。

en: How are you these days?
zh: 你最近怎么样？

en: How are you getting along these days?
zh: 你最近过得怎么样？

en: That young critic is in high demand for a lot of places.
zh: 那位年轻的评论家现在很受欢迎。

en: It is not rare for girls today to talk as if they were boys.
zh: 现在女孩说话像男孩一样的情况并不少见。

en: There aren't many good tunes coming out nowadays.
zh: 现在很少有好的曲子出现。

en: There is a limit of two pieces of luggage for each passenger.
zh: 每位乘客限带两件行李。

en: Each member has to pay a membership fee.
zh: 每位成员都必须支付会员费。

en: Each member has to pay 10,000 yen a month.
zh: 每位成员每月必须支付一万日元。

en: Each robot is equipped with a talking machine.
zh: 每个机器人都配备了说话装置。

en: He who wears armor falls with a big crash!
zh: 身穿盔甲的人摔倒时会发出巨大的声响！

en: Like water off a duck's back.
zh: 就像水从鸭背上滑落一样。（无动于衷）

en: The street, lined with trees, provided a vista of the sea.
zh: 街道两旁绿树成荫，可以眺望大海。

en: The streets are laid out quite well.
zh: 街道规划得很好。

en: No one was to be seen in the street.
zh: 街上空无一人。

en: We had lunch at a roadside restaurant.
zh: 我们在路边餐馆吃了午饭。

en: Houses were lined up alongside the highway.
zh: 房屋沿着高速公路排列。

en: The road tends to the south at the next village.
zh: 这条路在下一个村庄倾向南方。

en: I walked about aimlessly on the street.
zh: 我在街上漫无目的地走着。

en: Give us a ride downtown.
zh: 送我们去市中心吧。

en: I want to see the streets.
zh: 我想看看这里的街道。

en: The town was defended by a large army.
zh: 这个城镇由一支庞大的军队守卫。

en: More people live in the northern part of the city.
zh: 更多的人住在城市的北部。

en: Please give me a map of the town.
zh: 请给我一张城镇地图。

en: Living in the town is quite different from living in the country.
zh: 住在城镇和住在乡下很不一样。

en: There's an old movie theater in town.
zh: 镇上有一家老电影院。

en: Let's have lunch downtown and take in a show.
zh: 我们去市中心吃午饭，然后看场演出吧。

en: The town was flooded with strange foreign words.
zh: 这个小镇充斥着陌生的外来词汇。

en: As a rule, she is an early riser.
zh: 一般来说，她是个早起的人。

en: I cannot get the lid off.
zh: 我打不开盖子。

en: Generally speaking, Japanese are hard workers.
zh: 一般来说，日本人工作很努力。

en: The ambulances carried the injured to the nearest hospital.
zh: 救护车将伤员送往最近的医院。

en: Do you need an ambulance?
zh: 你需要救护车吗？

en: The ambulance broke down in the middle of the busy avenue.
zh: 救护车在繁忙的大道中央抛锚了。

en: The rescue worker beat the area, looking for the child.
zh: 救援人员在那个区域搜寻，寻找那个孩子。

en: He was still alive when the rescue party arrived.
zh: 救援队到达时，他仍然活着。

en: The rescue flight had to reckon with strong winds and freezing temperatures.
zh: 救援飞行不得不应对强风和冰冻的温度。

en: Urgent business prevented him from going.
zh: 紧急事务阻止了他前往。

en: Urgent business kept me from going shopping with you.
zh: 紧急事务使我无法和你一起去购物。

en: Urgent business kept me from coming soon.
zh: 紧急事务使我无法很快前来。

en: Urgent business prevented him from coming.
zh: 紧急事务阻止了他前来。

en: Urgent business has called him away.
zh: 紧急事务把他叫走了。

en: Urgent business kept him from going to the concert.
zh: 紧急事务使他无法去听音乐会。

en: A sudden illness prevented him from going there.
zh: 突发疾病阻止了他去那里。

en: A sudden illness forced her to cancel her appointment.
zh: 突发疾病迫使她取消了预约。

en: A sudden illness prevented me from going to the station to meet him.
zh: 突发疾病使我无法去车站接他。

en: The express train does not stop between Shibuya and Naka-Meguro.
zh: 特快列车在涩谷和中目黑之间不停靠。

en: The express train is an hour faster than the local.
zh: 特快列车比普通列车快一个小时。

en: Are there any express trains?
zh: 有特快列车吗？

en: The express train went by so fast that we hardly saw it.
zh: 特快列车飞驰而过，我们几乎没看清。

en: The express arrives at 6:30 p.m.
zh: 特快列车下午六点半到达。

en: The express starts at six and gets into Tokyo at nine.
zh: 特快列车六点出发，九点到达东京。

en: How much is the express?
zh: 特快列车多少钱？

en: To take an express train, we have to get an express ticket in addition to an ordinary ticket.
zh: 要乘坐特快列车，除了普通车票外，我们还必须购买特快车票。

en: I need medical help.
zh: 我需要医疗帮助。

en: Please hurry, it's urgent.
zh: 请快点，情况紧急。

en: You speak first; I will speak after.
zh: 你先说，我后说。

en: Well do I remember the day you were born.
zh: 我清楚地记得你出生的那天。

en: I guess you are right.
zh: 我猜你是对的。

en: If you are honest, I will hire you.
zh: 如果你诚实，我就雇用你。

en: Do what you think is right.
zh: 做你认为正确的事。

en: Your success depends on your efforts.
zh: 你的成功取决于你的努力。

en: Whether you will succeed or not depends on your efforts.
zh: 你是否会成功取决于你的努力。

en: I'm so glad that you succeeded.
zh: 我很高兴你成功了。

en: I am glad that you have succeeded.
zh: 我很高兴你成功了。

en: I'm glad to hear of your success.
zh: 我很高兴听到你成功的消息。

en: It's to your credit that you told the truth.
zh: 你说了实话，这值得称赞。

en: What happened to the girl you were sharing the bedroom with?
zh: 和你合住卧室的那个女孩怎么样了？

en: I should be glad if you got the job.
zh: 如果你得到这份工作，我会很高兴。

en: You may or may not win.
zh: 你可能会赢，也可能不会赢。

en: I will do it on the condition that you help me.
zh: 我会做这件事，条件是你帮助我。

en: If it were not for your help, I might have failed.
zh: 如果不是你的帮助，我可能已经失败了。

en: Thanks to your help, I could understand the book quite well.
zh: 多亏了你的帮助，我才能很好地理解这本书。

en: Your o's look like a's.
zh: 你写的o看起来像a。

en: They will have arrived there before you start.
zh: 他们会在你开始之前到达那里。

en: He came after you left.
zh: 你离开后他才来。

en: You must do your homework at once.
zh: 你必须立刻做你的作业。

en: Who took care of the dog while you were away?
zh: 你不在的时候谁照顾那条狗？

en: I will wait till you have written the letter.
zh: 我会等你写完信。

en: It is strange that you should fail.
zh: 你竟然会失败，这很奇怪。

en: You may fail, for all I care.
zh: 你可能会失败，我一点也不在乎。

en: If you study earnestly, you can expect to pass the exam.
zh: 如果你认真学习，你可以期望通过考试。

en: It's time for you to buy a new car.
zh: 你该买辆新车了。

en: It is high time you started a new business.
zh: 你早该开始一项新事业了。

en: How thoughtless of you to do that.
zh: 你这样做太欠考虑了。

en: You can rely on him. He never lets you down.
zh: 你可以依靠他。他从不让你失望。

en: You must clear the table.
zh: 你必须清理桌子。

en: Do you wash your hands before meals?
zh: 你饭前洗手吗？

en: I think you'd better go on a diet.
zh: 我认为你最好节食。

en: You bought the food, so if I buy the wine that will even things up.
zh: 你买了食物，所以如果我买酒，那就扯平了。

en: You really have a passion for food.
zh: 你真的对食物充满热情。

en: You had better not eat too much.
zh: 你最好不要吃太多。

en: You had better be careful not to overeat.
zh: 你最好小心不要吃得过饱。

en: You must account for your neglect of duty.
zh: 你必须解释你玩忽职守的原因。

en: You are way off the track.
zh: 你完全偏离方向了。

en: Are you in jest or in earnest?
zh: 你是开玩笑还是认真的？

en: You had better take a little rest.
zh: 你最好休息一下。

en: I think you'd better take a rest; you look ill.
zh: 我认为你最好休息一下；你看上去病了。

en: You're going too far.
zh: 你太过分了。

en: What do you want to do in the future?
zh: 你将来想做什么？

en: You work hard.
zh: 你工作很努力。

en: You are free to go out.
zh: 你可以自由外出。

en: You have a way with women.
zh: 你很会讨女人喜欢。

en: You are welcome to do anything you like.
zh: 你可以随意做任何你想做的事。

en: You should have known better than to take an examination without preparing for it.
zh: 你本应该知道，不准备就参加考试是不对的。

en: Did you do your homework by yourself?
zh: 你的作业是你自己做的吗？

en: I can't let the matter drop.
zh: 我不能就此罢休。

en: We just have to swallow it.
zh: 我们只能忍气吞声。

en: I quickly laugh at everything, for fear of having to cry.
zh: 我很快就拿一切开玩笑，因为害怕哭泣。

en: I feel like crying.
zh: 我想哭。

en: Try to keep from crying.
zh: 尽量别哭。

en: I could've cried.
zh: 我本来会哭的。

en: I can't help crying.
zh: 我忍不住哭。

en: I don't know whether to cry or to laugh.
zh: 我不知道是该哭还是该笑。

en: Crying is of no avail.
zh: 哭是没有用的。

en: There is only one day left, whether we like it or not.
zh: 不管我们喜不喜欢，只剩最后一天了。

en: It's hard to handle crying babies.
zh: 哭闹的婴儿很难哄。

en: And, many times, I've cried.
zh: 而且，很多时候，我都哭过。

en: Don't shout at the crying child. It only adds fuel to the fire.
zh: 不要对哭闹的孩子大喊大叫。这只会火上浇油。

en: The young man who has not wept is a savage, and the old man who will not laugh is a fool.
zh: 没有哭过的年轻人是野蛮人，不会笑的老人是傻瓜。

en: The job advertisement specifically requested females.
zh: 招聘广告特别要求女性。

en: Ask, and it shall be given you.
zh: 祈求，就给你们。

en: There is nothing that does not decay.
zh: 没有不腐烂的东西。

en: The lifeguard is ever ready to help others.
zh: 救生员随时准备帮助他人。

en: The rescue workers are going to hand out supplies to the victims of the earthquake.
zh: 救援人员将向地震灾民分发物资。

en: Try to hold on until a rescue team arrives.
zh: 尽量坚持到救援队到来。

en: The rescued refugees were longing for freedom.
zh: 获救的难民渴望自由。

en: We waited for hours before help arrived.
zh: 我们等了几个小时才等到救援。

en: She did not eat anything until she was rescued.
zh: 她获救之前什么都没吃。

en: Where should I go to be admitted into the emergency room?
zh: 我应该去哪里才能进入急诊室？

en: Call an ambulance.
zh: 叫救护车。

en: Your watch is similar to mine in shape and color.
zh: 你的手表和我的在形状和颜色上很相似。

en: Your watch is more expensive than mine.
zh: 你的手表比我的贵。

en: Your watch is ten minutes slow.
zh: 你的手表慢了十分钟。

en: What time is it by your watch?
zh: 你的手表现在几点了？

en: Where are your things?
zh: 你的东西在哪里？

en: It is not my part to meddle in your affairs.
zh: 干涉你的事情不是我该做的。

en: Your examination results are excellent.
zh: 你的考试成绩非常优秀。

en: Your point may be a little off target, but it certainly is close.
zh: 你的观点可能有点偏离目标，但肯定很接近了。

en: Just follow your heart.
zh: 跟着你的心走。

en: The population of your city is about five times as large as that of my town.
zh: 你的人口是你所在城市人口的五倍左右。

en: Your sister enjoys watching sumo wrestling on TV.
zh: 你妹妹喜欢在电视上看相扑。

en: Your sister's as beautiful as ever.
zh: 你妹妹还是一如既往地漂亮。

en: I am only too glad to help you with your work.
zh: 我非常乐意帮助你完成工作。

en: I think your work is all right.
zh: 我觉得你的工作还可以。

en: Your work is below average.
zh: 你的工作低于平均水平。

en: Your work didn't come up to our expectations.
zh: 你的工作没有达到我们的期望。

en: Your work comes short of the expected standard.
zh: 你的工作没有达到预期的标准。

en: What do you do?
zh: 你是做什么工作的？

en: Your work has greatly improved.
zh: 你的工作有了很大的进步。

en: How is your work coming along?
zh: 你的工作进展如何？

en: Don't take it amiss if I criticize your work.
zh: 如果我批评你的工作，请不要介意。

en: When your business gets rolling we'll talk about an increase.
zh: 当你的生意好转时，我们会讨论加薪的事。

en: May we accompany you on your walk?
zh: 我们可以陪你一起散步吗？

en: I left your umbrella in the bus.
zh: 我把你的伞落在公共汽车上了。

en: All the compositions were good except yours.
zh: 所有的作文都很好，除了你的。

en: I don't think that technology provides us with everything we need.
zh: 我不认为科技能提供我们所需的一切。

en: Science can be dangerous when applied carelessly.
zh: 当应用不当时，科学可能是危险的。

en: Science is based on very careful observations.
zh: 科学是建立在非常仔细的观察之上的。

en: Science has made remarkable progress.
zh: 科学已经取得了显著的进步。

en: Science is based on careful observation.
zh: 科学是建立在仔细观察的基础上的。

en: Science is far more than a collection of facts and methods.
zh: 科学远不止是一系列的事实和方法。

en: Science brought about many changes in our lives.
zh: 科学给我们的生活带来了许多变化。

en: Science has brought about many changes in our lives.
zh: 科学给我们的生活带来了许多变化。

en: Science has made rapid progress in this century.
zh: 科学在本世纪取得了快速的进步。

en: I do not like science.
zh: 我不喜欢科学。

en: Science rests upon observation.
zh: 科学建立在观察之上。

en: Science is a good thing, but it is not an end in itself; it is a means toward an end and that end is human betterment.
zh: 科学是件好事，但它本身不是目的；它是一种达到目的的手段，而那个目的是人类的改善。

en: Science is the way to prepare for the 21st century.
zh: 科学是为21世纪做准备的方式。

en: The aim of science is, as has often been said, to foresee, not to understand.
zh: 正如常说的那样，科学的目的是预见，而不是理解。

en: The primary aim of science is to find truth, new truth.
zh: 科学的主要目的是寻找真理，新的真理。

en: Advances in science don't always benefit humanity.
zh: 科学的进步并不总是对人类有益。

en: Advance in science is continuous.
zh: 科学的进步是持续不断的。

en: Progress in science was often barred by convention.
zh: 科学的进步常常受到传统的阻碍。

en: The progress of science has brought about great change in our lives.
zh: 科学的进步给我们的生活带来了巨大的变化。

en: In science class, we drew pictures of cells.
zh: 在科学课上，我们画了细胞的图片。

en: Science and art must contribute to the promotion of human welfare.
zh: 科学和艺术必须为促进人类福祉做出贡献。

en: Science as such is not interested in the value or worth of things.
zh: 科学本身对事物的价值或意义不感兴趣。

en: Science does not solve all the problems of life.
zh: 科学不能解决生活中的所有问题。

en: Science has not solved all the problems of life.
zh: 科学还没有解决生活中的所有问题。

en: If science makes progress, we'll be able to solve such problems.
zh: 如果科学取得进步，我们将能够解决这些问题。

en: Is there a milkman?
zh: 有送牛奶的工人吗？

en: Add a little milk.
zh: 加一点牛奶。

en: Do you have some milk?
zh: 你有牛奶吗？

en: Won't you have another glass of milk?
zh: 不再来一杯牛奶吗？

en: We make milk into cheese and butter.
zh: 我们把牛奶做成奶酪和黄油。

en: I bought two bottles of milk.
zh: 我买了两个瓶子的牛奶。

en: I want a quart of milk.
zh: 我想要一夸脱牛奶。

en: The milk froze and became solid.
zh: 牛奶结冰变硬了。

en: Milk is a popular beverage.
zh: 牛奶是一种受欢迎的饮料。

en: Milk boils at a higher temperature than water.
zh: 牛奶的沸点比水高。

en: Milk does not agree with me.
zh: 我喝牛奶不舒服。

en: Milk makes us strong.
zh: 牛奶使我们强壮。

en: Milk easily turns sour.
zh: 牛奶容易变酸。

en: Milk is made into butter and cheese.
zh: 牛奶被制成黄油和奶酪。

en: There's only a little milk left.
zh: 只剩下一点牛奶了。

en: Milk is made into butter.
zh: 牛奶被制成黄油。

en: Milk can be made into butter, cheese, and many other things.
zh: 牛奶可以制成黄油、奶酪和许多其他东西。

en: Milk will do you good. You'd better drink it every day.
zh: 喝牛奶对你有好处。你最好每天都喝。

en: The milk turned sour.
zh: 牛奶变酸了。

en: Will you drink wine instead of milk?
zh: 你喝葡萄酒代替牛奶吗？

en: The milk was adulterated with water.
zh: 牛奶里掺了水。

en: Blend milk and eggs together.
zh: 把牛奶和鸡蛋混合在一起。

en: The milk has gone bad.
zh: 牛奶变质了。

en: The milk has turned sour.
zh: 牛奶变酸了。

en: You must buy milk, eggs, butter, and so on.
zh: 你必须买牛奶、鸡蛋、黄油等等。

en: The vase was broken to pieces.
zh: 花瓶摔成了碎片。

en: The vase crashed to pieces.
zh: 花瓶摔得粉碎。

en: The roses in the garden smell sweet.
zh: 花园里的玫瑰花闻起来很香。

en: The tulips are in bloom in the flower bed.
zh: 花坛里的郁金香正在盛开。

en: Hanako called his bluff.
zh: 花子识破了他的虚张声势。

en: Hanako made the final payment on her car, and felt very satisfied.
zh: 花子付清了汽车的尾款，感到非常满意。

en: It was clear that Hanako did not wish to marry Taro.
zh: 很明显，花子不想嫁给太郎。

en: Hanako has forgotten her umbrella again.
zh: 花子又忘了带伞。

en: Hanako is set on going to Paris.
zh: 花子铁了心要去巴黎。

en: Hanako likes cake very much.
zh: 花子非常喜欢蛋糕。

en: Hanako grew taller than her mother.
zh: 花子长得比她妈妈还高了。

en: Hanako seems quiet, but she also get things done when it's necessary.
zh: 花子看起来很安静，但必要的时候她也能把事情做好。

en: Hanako has attended an American college for four years.
zh: 花子在美国的大学上了四年学。

en: Hanako came all the way from Hokkaido in order to see her father.
zh: 花子特地从北海道赶来见她的父亲。

en: Hanako turned out to be a surprisingly nice person.
zh: 花子原来是个出人意料的好人。

en: I can't wait for spring to come so we can sit under the cherry trees.
zh: 我迫不及待地想让春天到来，这样我们就可以坐在樱花树下了。

en: A wreath was bound around his head.
zh: 一个花环缠绕在他的头上。

en: Bees are flying among the flowers.
zh: 蜜蜂在花丛中飞舞。

en: Blossoms have come out on the embankment.
zh: 堤坝上的花都开了。

en: They set off fireworks with a great bang.
zh: 他们砰的一声放起了烟花。

en: The fireworks were set off on all sides.
zh: 四面八方都放起了烟花。

en: She was all the more beautiful dressed in her wedding costume.
zh: 她穿上结婚礼服后更加美丽了。

en: The bride came into the room with lowered eyes and with everyone staring at her.
zh: 新娘低着头走进房间，大家都盯着她看。

en: The bride came into the room, with everyone staring at her.
zh: 新娘走进房间，大家都盯着她看。

en: The bride looked very beautiful.
zh: 新娘看起来非常漂亮。

en: Where can I go to buy art books and catalogues?
zh: 我应该去哪里购买美术书籍和目录？

en: A painter only becomes a true painter by practicing his craft.
zh: 画家只有通过练习他的技艺才能成为真正的画家。

en: The artist captured the charm of the lady.
zh: 这位艺术家捕捉到了这位女士的魅力。

en: A painter's eyes are his most important tools.
zh: 画家的眼睛是他最重要的工具。

en: I'm not a toothless barking dog.
zh: 我不是一只没牙的吠犬。

en: I can't put up with it.
zh: 我受不了了。

en: I'll bite the bullet.
zh: 我会咬紧牙关挺过去的。

en: Bite the bullet.
zh: 咬紧牙关。

en: Our company has annual sales of a thousand million yen.
zh: 我们公司每年的销售额是十亿日元。

en: We Japanese live on rice.
zh: 我们日本人以米饭为主食。

en: We Japanese come of age at twenty.
zh: 我们日本人二十岁成年。

en: The two of us don't belong here.
zh: 我们俩不属于这里。

en: Not all of us can speak English.
zh: 我们并非所有人都会说英语。

en: We all agree to the new plan.
zh: 我们都同意这个新计划。

en: We consumers must buy more domestic products.
zh: 我们消费者必须购买更多的国货。

en: We students all like baseball.
zh: 我们学生都喜欢棒球。

en: We spent the afternoon fooling around on the beach.
zh: 我们一下午都在海滩上闲逛。

en: We students are now at our best.
zh: 我们学生现在正值最佳状态。

en: We were all assailed with fears.
zh: 我们都被恐惧所袭击。

en: He died, so we might live.
zh: 他死了，我们才能活下去。

en: We came together to form a group.
zh: 我们聚在一起组成了一个团体。

en: We had better do what other people do.
zh: 我们最好随大流。

en: Were you just pulling my leg when you said we were all going to get extra bonuses?
zh: 你刚才说我们都会得到额外的奖金，只是在开玩笑吗？

en: We were cut off while talking on the telephone.
zh: 我们打电话时被切断了。

en: We should hold old people in reverence.
zh: 我们应该尊敬老人。

en: We see things differently according to whether we are rich or poor.
zh: 我们根据贫富不同，看待事物的方式也不同。

en: The rich are not always happier than the poor.
zh: 富人并不总是比穷人更快乐。

en: He may be rich, but he is stingy.
zh: 他可能很富有，但他很吝啬。

en: The papers that were in the safe are gone.
zh: 保险箱里的文件不见了。

en: I put money in a safe.
zh: 我把钱放在保险箱里。

en: Lock the safe.
zh: 锁上保险箱。

en: I'm broke.
zh: 我身无分文。

en: I'm feeding the goldfish.
zh: 我在喂金鱼。

en: Regardless of the amount, Brian wants the correct, entire amount by next week.
zh: 不管金额多少，布莱恩下周之前要拿到正确、完整的金额。

en: The gold coin was much more valuable than was supposed.
zh: 这枚金币比预想的更有价值。

en: There is a gold coin.
zh: 这里有一枚金币。

en: I had to resort to threats to get my money back.
zh: 我不得不采取威胁手段才能要回我的钱。

en: Many men went west in search of gold.
zh: 许多人去西部寻找黄金。

en: Lend your money and lose your friend.
zh: 借钱给朋友，友谊玩完。

en: I should have taken the money.
zh: 我本应该拿走那笔钱的。

en: He who pays the piper calls the tune.
zh: 谁出钱，谁说了算。

en: Get out your wallet.
zh: 拿出你的钱包。

en: I don't want to lend or borrow.
zh: 我不想借钱或贷款。

en: Lend me some money, if you have any.
zh: 如果你有钱，借我一些。

en: It is foolish to equate money with happiness.
zh: 把金钱和幸福划等号是愚蠢的。

en: I will do it on condition that I am paid.
zh: 我会做的，条件是给我报酬。

en: We die whether we make money or not.
zh: 无论我们是否赚钱，我们都会死去。

en: The loss of money made it impossible for him to go abroad.
zh: 失去金钱使他无法出国。

en: It's money down the drain.
zh: 这简直是浪费钱。

en: We must cut our expenses to save money.
zh: 我们必须削减开支来存钱。

en: Your study will bear fruit.
zh: 你的学习会结出果实。

en: Your dog may be really depressed.
zh: 你的狗可能真的很沮丧。

en: What's become of your dog?
zh: 你的狗怎么了？

en: I have been anxious about your health.
zh: 我一直很担心你的健康。

en: I envy your good health.
zh: 我羡慕你的好身体。

en: Your conclusion is highly arguable.
zh: 你的结论很有争议。

en: Your decision is open to some debate.
zh: 你的决定值得商榷。

en: You can go or stay, as you wish.
zh: 你想走就走，想留就留。

en: I'm sorry to upset your plans.
zh: 我很抱歉打乱了你的计划。

en: I will go along with your plan.
zh: 我会支持你的计划。

en: Your plan is of no earthly use.
zh: 你的计划毫无用处。

en: Your scheme is like a house built on the sand.
zh: 你的计划就像建在沙子上的房子。

en: Your plan is bound to fail.
zh: 你的计划注定要失败。

en: I'm afraid your plan will not work.
zh: 恐怕你的计划行不通。

en: Tell me the object of your plan.
zh: 告诉我你计划的目的。

en: Your plan seems better than mine.
zh: 你的计划似乎比我的好。

en: I approve of your plan.
zh: 我赞成你的计划。

en: Tell me about your plan.
zh: 跟我说说你的计划。

en: Admittedly your plan makes sense, but I still think it will be very hard to carry out.
zh: 诚然，你的计划有道理，但我仍然认为很难实施。

en: There is a big hole in your stocking.
zh: 你的袜子破了个大洞。

en: Your shoes do not go with the suit.
zh: 你的鞋子和这套西装不搭。

en: Your shoes are here. Where are mine?
zh: 你的鞋子在这里。我的呢？

en: Your shoes are here.
zh: 你的鞋子在这里。

en: I'm sick of listening to your complaints.
zh: 我厌倦了听你的抱怨。

en: I cannot help laughing at your folly.
zh: 我忍不住嘲笑你的愚蠢。

en: Come what may, I am determined to accomplish it.
zh: 无论如何，我决心要完成它。

en: I will stand by you whatever happens.
zh: 无论发生什么事，我都会支持你。

en: Everybody was anxious to know what had happened.
zh: 大家都急于想知道发生了什么事。

en: He felt that something was about to happen.
zh: 他觉得有什么事情要发生了。

en: Whatever may happen, I am prepared for it.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都准备好了。

en: I ordered some new books from America.
zh: 我从美国订购了一些新书。

en: Where's your head at?
zh: 你在想什么呢？

en: What language is spoken in America?
zh: 美国说什么语言？

en: Why did she interrupt me?
zh: 她为什么打断我？

en: Why didn't you tell her?
zh: 你为什么没告诉她？

en: What do you think caused him to lose his job?
zh: 你认为是什么原因导致他失业的？

en: I cannot conceive why she has done such a thing.
zh: 我无法理解她为什么要做出这样的事。

en: Do you know why they stopped talking?
zh: 你知道他们为什么停止说话吗？

en: Why didn't you tell it to me in advance?
zh: 你为什么不事先告诉我？

en: Why am I shooting these guys, tell me, what have they done?
zh: 我为什么要射杀这些人，告诉我，他们做了什么？

en: Why were you silent all the time?
zh: 你为什么一直沉默不语？

en: How come Mary is going on a picnic with him?
zh: 玛丽怎么会和他一起去野餐呢？

en: The reason is because I can speak Chinese.
zh: 原因是，我会说中文。

en: Why do you think so?
zh: 你为什么这么认为？

en: What did you go there for?
zh: 你去那里做什么？

en: Why didn't you come?
zh: 你为什么没来？

en: What do you mean, why don't I ever say it?
zh: 你是什么意思，为什么我从不说？

en: What are you talking about!?
zh: 你在说什么！？

en: Several cottages have been isolated by the flood water.
zh: 几间小屋被洪水隔离了。

en: A casual remark can hurt someone.
zh: 一句不经意的话可能会伤害到别人。

en: I asked for a seat in the no-smoking section.
zh: 我要求坐在无烟区。

en: I asked for a seat in the non-smoking section.
zh: 我要求坐在无烟区。

en: I would like to sit in the non-smoking section.
zh: 我想坐在无烟区。

en: Do you have a non-smoking section?
zh: 你们有无烟区吗？

en: Could we have a table in the non-smoking section?
zh: 我们可以在无烟区要一张桌子吗？

en: Smoking or non smoking?
zh: 吸烟区还是无烟区？

en: I advise you to stop smoking.
zh: 我建议你戒烟。

en: It is difficult to give up smoking.
zh: 戒烟很难。

en: There are marked and rapidly, steadily increasing health benefits to giving up.
zh: 戒烟对健康有显著且快速、稳定增长的益处。

en: I'll give up smoking.
zh: 我要戒烟。

en: What method did you use to give up smoking?
zh: 你用什么方法戒烟的？

en: Please refrain from smoking, while the non-smoking signs are on.
zh: 请勿吸烟，当无烟标志亮着的时候。

en: Thank you for not smoking.
zh: 谢谢您不吸烟。

en: Hard work has made Japan what it is today.
zh: 努力工作造就了今天的日本。

en: You must work very hard on duty.
zh: 你必须在工作时非常努力。

en: The police officer on duty sensed an elderly man coming up behind him.
zh: 值班的警察感觉到一位老人走到他身后。

en: Smoking on duty is not allowed.
zh: 上班时间不允许吸烟。

en: Don't smoke while you are on duty.
zh: 上班时不要吸烟。

en: The workers complained when their working hours were extended.
zh: 工人们抱怨工作时间延长。

en: Diligence is the way to success.
zh: 勤奋是成功的途径。

en: Diligence is the mother of good fortune.
zh: 勤奋是好运之母。

en: Hard work is the price of success.
zh: 努力工作是成功的代价。

en: Hard work is the main element of success.
zh: 努力工作是成功的主要因素。

en: Diligence is essential to success in life.
zh: 勤奋是人生成功的关键。

en: Diligence led him to success.
zh: 勤奋使他走向成功。

en: It may sound strange, but what she said is true.
zh: 这听起来可能很奇怪，但她说的是真的。

en: Strange as it may sound, this is true.
zh: 这听起来可能很奇怪，但这是真的。

en: It may sound strange, but what he said is true.
zh: 这听起来可能很奇怪，但他说的却是真的。

en: It sounds strange, but it is true none the less.
zh: 这听起来很奇怪，但无论如何这是真的。

en: It may sound strange, but it is true.
zh: 这听起来可能很奇怪，但这是真的。

en: Strangely, the number of students is decreasing each year.
zh: 奇怪的是，学生人数逐年减少。

en: Strange to say, he saw the ghost of his father.
zh: 说来奇怪，他看到了他父亲的鬼魂。

en: Oddly enough, he insisted on his innocence.
zh: 说也奇怪，他坚持自己是无辜的。

en: Strange to say, no one voted for the candidate.
zh: 说来奇怪，没有人投票给这位候选人。

en: A curious disease struck the town.
zh: 一种奇怪的疾病袭击了这个城镇。

en: A strange fellow, he never speaks unless spoken to.
zh: 他是个奇怪的人，除非别人跟他说话，否则他从不说话。

en: Strange to say, he met someone who was said to be dead.
zh: 说来奇怪，他遇到了一个据说已经死了的人。

en: He's possessed by a strange idea.
zh: 他被一个奇怪的想法迷住了。

en: There are strange rumors afloat.
zh: 到处都有奇怪的谣言。

en: Curiously, a flower bloomed on the withered up tree.
zh: 奇怪的是，一朵花在枯萎的树上开了。

en: Curious to say, I didn't find it anywhere.
zh: 说来也奇怪，我到处都没找到它。

en: Strange to say, he didn't know the news.
zh: 说来奇怪，他竟然不知道这个消息。

en: Strange to say, the door opened of itself.
zh: 说来奇怪，门自己开了。

en: Strange as it is, the story is true.
zh: 虽然这很奇怪，但这个故事是真的。

en: Strange things happened on her birthday.
zh: 在她生日那天发生了一些奇怪的事情。

en: A novel idea occurred to me.
zh: 我突然有了一个新奇的想法。

en: It's nothing short of a miracle.
zh: 这简直就是一个奇迹。

en: He won't be able to escape from there without a miracle, will he?
zh: 如果没有奇迹发生，他不可能从那里逃脱，对吧？

en: Unless there is a miracle, we won't be able to make it on time.
zh: 除非出现奇迹，否则我们无法准时到达。

en: Odd numbers alternate with even ones.
zh: 奇数和偶数交替出现。

en: What you did is against the rules.
zh: 你做的事情违反了规则。

en: Your time is up.
zh: 你的时间到了。

en: It was very hard for me to find your flat.
zh: 我很难找到你的公寓。

en: Look about you.
zh: 看看你周围。

en: I blush for your mistake.
zh: 我为你的错误感到羞愧。

en: I'll give you anything that you want.
zh: 你想要什么我都给你。

en: What's new with you? How is your new job working out?
zh: 你最近怎么样？新工作怎么样？

en: You have the advantage of me.
zh: 你比我更有优势。

en: Can I use your pen?
zh: 我能用一下你的笔吗？

en: Your pen is better than mine.
zh: 你的笔比我的好。

en: As you make your bed, so you must lie in it.
zh: 自作自受。

en: Your plan sounds great.
zh: 你的计划听起来很棒。

en: Your pitching is far superior to mine.
zh: 你的投球比我的好多了。

en: If I find your passport, I'll call you at once.
zh: 如果我找到你的护照，我会立刻给你打电话。

en: Your tie blends well with your suit.
zh: 你的领带和你的西装很搭。

en: Your tie has come undone.
zh: 你的领带松了。

en: Your dress is very nice.
zh: 你的裙子真漂亮。

en: I'll give you a call before I visit you.
zh: 拜访你之前我会给你打个电话。

en: I'll come to your place.
zh: 我会去你家。

en: Your team doesn't have a prayer to win the championship game.
zh: 你的球队根本没有机会赢得冠军赛。

en: I'm glad that your team won the game.
zh: 我很高兴你的球队赢了比赛。

en: I have good news in store for you.
zh: 我为你准备了好消息。

en: I'll make a model plane for you.
zh: 我会为你做一个飞机模型。

en: I'm not going out on a limb for you because you never helped me before.
zh: 我不会为你冒险，因为你以前从没帮过我。

en: Choose such friends as will benefit you.
zh: 选择对你有益的朋友。

en: We shot pheasants by the hundred.
zh: 我们猎杀了成百上千只野鸡。

en: Hundreds of people were on the spot.
zh: 现场有数百人。

en: Hundreds of people called or wrote to the Gorilla Foundation.
zh: 数百人致电或写信给大猩猩基金会。

en: Hundreds of buffaloes moved toward the lake.
zh: 数百头水牛向湖边移动。

en: I saw some monkeys climbing the tree.
zh: 我看到一些猴子在爬树。

en: What number bus do I take?
zh: 我该坐几路公交车？

en: How many nights would you like the room for?
zh: 您想订几晚的房间？

en: For how many nights?
zh: 订几晚？

en: After a couple of drinks, the guy was feeling no pain.
zh: 喝了几杯酒后，那家伙感觉很舒服。

en: Lately, I've been letting my English go. It seems I'll never improve at it, no matter how many years I study.
zh: 最近，我一直在放松英语学习。 似乎无论我学习多少年，我都不会进步。

en: For years Marina had been inspecting houses.
zh: 多年来，玛丽娜一直在检查房屋。

en: I haven't seen him for years.
zh: 我已经好几年没见过他了。

en: Years of farm work have hardened his body.
zh: 多年的农活使他的身体变得强壮。

en: For years the picture passed as a genuine Rembrandt.
zh: 多年来，这幅画一直被认为是伦勃朗的真迹。

en: I wonder if she will recognize me after all those years.
zh: 我想知道这么多年后她是否还能认出我。

en: How long have you been studying English?
zh: 你学英语多久了？

en: Some years ago, learning that one had tuberculosis amounted to hearing a sentence of death.
zh: 几年前，得知自己得了肺结核就相当于听到了死刑判决。

en: Years ago, she used to hang around with a bunch of bikers.
zh: 几年前，她过去常常和一群骑摩托车的人混在一起。

en: How long are you going to stay?
zh: 你打算待多久？

en: You might have to eat those words a few years from now.
zh: 几年后，你可能不得不收回那些话。

en: How early do I have to make a reservation to qualify for the discount?
zh: 我必须提前多久预订才能获得折扣？

en: Can you hike for days in the wilderness without seeing anyone?
zh: 你能在荒野中徒步旅行几天而不见任何人吗？

en: It snowed for many days together.
zh: 连续下了好几天的雪。

en: It rained for several days on end.
zh: 连续下了好几天的雨。

en: How long are you going to stay here?
zh: 你打算在这里待多久？

en: Something is being looked for.
zh: 正在寻找什么东西。

en: It's no good waiting for something to happen; you must take action at once.
zh: 等待事情发生是没用的，你必须立刻采取行动。

en: Has anything strange happened?
zh: 发生什么奇怪的事情了吗？

en: Something happened and he couldn't keep his promise.
zh: 发生了一些事情，他无法遵守承诺。

en: I hope I can be of some help to you.
zh: 我希望我能帮到你。

en: Can I do anything for you?
zh: 我能为你做些什么吗？

en: I told her that if I could be of any use I would be glad to help.
zh: 我告诉她，如果我能帮上忙，我很乐意帮忙。

en: What shall I do for you?
zh: 我该为你做些什么呢？

en: If you find an interesting book, please buy it for me.
zh: 如果你找到一本有趣的书，请帮我买下来。

en: Lend me something interesting to read.
zh: 借我一些有趣的东西看看。

en: You should put something in your stomach before you go.
zh: 你应该在走之前吃点东西垫垫肚子。

en: Do we have anything I can snack on?
zh: 我们有什么可以当零食吃吗？

en: Go and see for yourself what has happened.
zh: 你自己去看看发生了什么事。

en: Something strange caught my eye.
zh: 一些奇怪的东西引起了我的注意。

en: What makes you laugh like that?
zh: 什么事让你笑成这样？

en: Press the red button if something strange happens.
zh: 如果发生什么奇怪的事情，请按红色按钮。

en: What are you laughing at? It's a fact. No kidding!
zh: 你笑什么？这是事实。不开玩笑！

en: What do you suggest?
zh: 你有什么建议？

en: I feel that something is wrong.
zh: 我感觉有些不对劲。

en: Have you found any good solution?
zh: 你找到什么好的解决方案了吗？

en: I need some good advice.
zh: 我需要一些好的建议。

en: I had a hunch something pleasant was going to happen.
zh: 我预感到会有什么愉快的事情发生。

en: What's the good news?
zh: 有什么好消息吗？

en: What kind of part-time job do you have?
zh: 你做什么样的兼职工作？

en: What made you come here?
zh: 什么让你来这里的？

en: As soon as we find out anything, we will contact him.
zh: 我们一有消息就会联系他。

en: I was conscious that something was missing.
zh: 我意识到少了点什么。

en: I haven't heard from him these several months.
zh: 我已经好几个月没收到他的消息了。

en: You must take up a regular occupation.
zh: 你必须找一份正经工作。

en: I'd like something light.
zh: 我想要一些清淡的。

en: Do you have a plan?
zh: 你有什么计划吗？

en: What's worrying you?
zh: 你在担心什么？

en: Something terrible is about to happen.
zh: 可怕的事情就要发生了。

en: I had a feeling that something dreadful was happening.
zh: 我有一种不祥的预感，觉得有什么可怕的事情正在发生。

en: I have a feeling that something dreadful is going to happen.
zh: 我有一种不祥的预感，觉得有什么可怕的事情要发生。

en: Something dreadful has happened to Miss Davidson.
zh: 戴维森小姐一定是出了什么可怕的事。

en: Ask him if you have any doubt.
zh: 如果你有任何疑问，就问他。

en: What's going on?
zh: 发生了什么事？

en: No matter what happens, I will never change my mind.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都不会改变主意。

en: Come what may, I am prepared for it.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都准备好了。

en: I'll stand by you whatever happens.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都会支持你。

en: We ought to be ready for whatever comes.
zh: 我们应该为即将发生的一切做好准备。

en: He told me that whatever might happen, he was prepared for it.
zh: 他告诉我，无论发生什么，他都准备好了。

en: We should obey the law no matter what happens.
zh: 无论发生什么，我们都应该遵守法律。

en: Whatever happens, please remember I'll stand by you.
zh: 无论发生什么，请记住我会支持你。

en: Come what may, I'm ready for it.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都准备好了。

en: Come what may, I will never leave you.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都永远不会离开你。

en: I'll keep my word, whatever may happen.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都会信守诺言。

en: Come what may; I won't change my mind.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都不会改变主意。

en: Had he known what was about to happen, he would have changed his plan.
zh: 如果他知道即将发生什么，他就会改变他的计划。

en: It's clear that our arguments don't overlap at all.
zh: 很明显，我们的观点没有任何交集。

en: Our interest converges on that point.
zh: 我们的利益在那一点上趋于一致。

en: Relations between us seem to be on the ebb.
zh: 我们之间的关系似乎在衰退。

en: From our point of view, his proposal is reasonable.
zh: 从我们的角度来看，他的提议是合理的。

en: Our school is very close to the park.
zh: 我们的学校离公园很近。

en: Our school prohibits us from going to the movies alone.
zh: 我们学校禁止我们独自去看电影。

en: We will adopt your method at our school.
zh: 我们将在我们学校采用你的方法。

en: Our diplomacy and strategy ran in clear contradiction to each other.
zh: 我们的外交和战略明显相互矛盾。

en: In our interpretation, the output data in Table 2 is an acceptable variation of that in Table 1.
zh: 根据我们的理解，表2中的输出数据是表1中数据的可接受的变体。

en: Our company needs someone who is at home in advanced technology.
zh: 我们公司需要精通先进技术的人才。

en: Our company failed to survive against cutthroat competition.
zh: 我们公司在激烈的竞争中未能生存下来。

en: Our company makes use of the Internet.
zh: 我们公司利用互联网。

en: It took quite a while to sort out all our luggage.
zh: 整理我们所有的行李花了不少时间。

en: Our earnings are in proportion to our real ability.
zh: 我们的收入与我们的实际能力成正比。

en: Compared to our house, his is a palace.
zh: 和我们的房子相比，他的房子简直是宫殿。

en: It is very hard to get rid of cockroaches from our house.
zh: 要清除我们家里的蟑螂非常困难。

en: Our yacht club has ten members.
zh: 我们的游艇俱乐部有十名成员。

en: Our meeting rarely starts on time.
zh: 我们的会议很少准时开始。

en: Since neither one of us could afford to take the other to the movies, we went Dutch.
zh: 因为我们俩都负担不起请对方去看电影，所以我们AA制。

en: Our country's climate is temperate.
zh: 我们国家的气候是温带气候。

en: Our team is winning.
zh: 我们的队伍正在获胜。

en: Our team were wearing red shirts.
zh: 我们的队伍穿着红色衬衫。

en: Our team competed with a powerful rival.
zh: 我们的队伍与一个强大的对手竞争。

en: Our team won the game.
zh: 我们的队伍赢得了比赛。

en: Our team is five points ahead.
zh: 我们的队伍领先五分。

en: We finally decided to give him over to the police.
zh: 我们最终决定把他交给警察。

en: We came to an agreement in the end.
zh: 我们最终达成了一致。

en: We have to do a great deal of reading.
zh: 我们必须进行大量的阅读。

en: We overwhelmed the many enemies.
zh: 我们压倒了众多敌人。

en: We are inclined to think that most dogs bite.
zh: 我们倾向于认为大多数狗都会咬人。

en: We associate Darwin with the theory of evolution.
zh: 我们将达尔文与进化论联系起来。

en: We didn't go very far.
zh: 我们没走多远。

en: There was nothing for it but to tolerate it.
zh: 我们别无选择，只能忍受它。

en: We looked for it here and there.
zh: 我们到处寻找它。

en: We depended on the newspapers for information about it.
zh: 我们依靠报纸获取有关它的信息。

en: We shared the benefit together.
zh: 我们一起分享了利益。

en: We put up at a lakeside hotel for the night.
zh: 我们在湖边的一家酒店住了一晚。

en: We fought for our lives in the storm.
zh: 我们在暴风雨中为生存而战。

en: We bedded down at the roadside park for the night.
zh: 我们在路边公园过夜。

en: We investigated the matter from all angles.
zh: 我们从各个角度调查了此事。

en: We will discuss the problem with them.
zh: 我们将与他们讨论这个问题。

en: We debated the problem.
zh: 我们辩论了这个问题。

en: We must look at the problem from a global point of view.
zh: 我们必须从全球的角度来看待这个问题。

en: We have discussed the problem several times but to no avail.
zh: 我们已经讨论过这个问题几次了，但毫无结果。

en: We discussed the matter at large.
zh: 我们广泛地讨论了这件事。

en: We have to bring the matter to a close.
zh: 我们必须结束这件事。

en: We should try to look at the wider problem.
zh: 我们应该尝试看看更广泛的问题。

en: We beat about for a solution to the problem.
zh: 我们四处寻找解决问题的办法。

en: We discussed the problem.
zh: 我们讨论了这个问题。

en: We discussed the matter.
zh: 我们讨论了这件事。

en: You're a friend of Tom's, eh?
zh: 你是汤姆的朋友，是吧？

en: How do you get to school?
zh: 你怎样去学校？

en: Which club do you belong to?
zh: 你属于哪个俱乐部？

en: How high can you jump?
zh: 你能跳多高？

en: How tall are you?
zh: 你有多高？

en: You are very brave.
zh: 你非常勇敢。

en: You look very tired.
zh: 你看上去很累。

en: That's very sweet of you.
zh: 你真好。

en: Which bed do you want to use?
zh: 你想用哪张床？

en: It's about time you got here!
zh: 你总算来了！

en: Which one do you take?
zh: 你选哪一个？

en: Which of your parents do you take after?
zh: 你像你的父母中的哪一个？

en: You may go anywhere you like.
zh: 你想去哪里都可以。

en: Wherever you go, you'll be welcomed.
zh: 无论你去哪里，你都会受到欢迎。

en: Which college are you aiming for?
zh: 你的目标是哪所大学？

en: Where do you attend high school?
zh: 你在哪里上高中？

en: Where were you?
zh: 你在哪里？

en: Do you feel at home anywhere?
zh: 你在哪里有家的感觉吗？

en: How did you obtain these old postage stamps?
zh: 你是怎么得到这些旧邮票的？

en: How about you?
zh: 你呢？

en: How did you come to know her?
zh: 你是怎么认识她的？

en: Why don't you try to take your money back?
zh: 你为什么不试着把你的钱要回来呢？

en: What has made you decide to work for our company?
zh: 是什么让你决定为我们公司工作？

en: How did you come up with such a good excuse?
zh: 你是怎么想出这么好的借口的？

en: Why did you say such a thing?
zh: 你为什么说那样的话？

en: You should be more thoughtful of your safety.
zh: 你应该多为自己的安全着想。

en: You should read such books as will benefit you.
zh: 你应该读那些对你有益的书。

en: You are responsible for what you have done.
zh: 你对你所做的事情负责。

en: You should read such books as you consider important.
zh: 你应该读那些你认为重要的书。

en: You yourself have to finish it.
zh: 你必须自己完成它。

en: You must do it yourself.
zh: 你必须自己做。

en: Are you sure of your facts?
zh: 你确定你的事实吗？

en: You had better take into consideration that you are no longer young.
zh: 你最好考虑到你不再年轻了。

en: You must admit that you are in the wrong.
zh: 你必须承认你错了。

en: You should have introduced yourself.
zh: 你应该自我介绍一下。

en: You must control yourself.
zh: 你必须控制自己。

en: You are the next in line for promotion.
zh: 你是下一个晋升的人。

en: You ought to get to work on time.
zh: 你应该准时上班。

en: You should look after the children from time to time.
zh: 你应该不时地照顾孩子们。

en: There is need for improvement in your handwriting.
zh: 你的笔迹需要改进。

en: You write a very good hand.
zh: 你的字写得很好。

en: You must face the facts.
zh: 你必须面对现实。

en: You ought to see a dentist.
zh: 你应该去看牙医。

en: You must employ your capital well.
zh: 你必须好好利用你的资本。

en: You may as well prepare for your examination.
zh: 你最好准备你的考试。

en: You should study hard so that you can pass the examination.
zh: 你应该努力学习，以便通过考试。

en: You are expected to pass the exam.
zh: 大家期望你通过考试。

en: Do you take me for a fool?
zh: 你把我当傻瓜吗？

en: You may laugh at me.
zh: 你可以嘲笑我。

en: You do me wrong.
zh: 你冤枉我了。

en: The accountant will go into these figures.
zh: 会计会仔细研究这些数字。

en: When the accountant was arrested, rumour had it that it was for his creative bookkeeping.
zh: 会计被捕时，传闻说是因为他做了假账。

en: Could I have the check?
zh: 我可以结账了吗？

en: Pay the cashier on the way out.
zh: 请在离开时到收银台付款。

en: Could you add the cost to my room bill?
zh: 可以把费用加到我的房费账单上吗？

en: Where is the counter to pay my bill?
zh: 请问在哪里结账？

en: The accounts have been audited.
zh: 账目已经审计过了。

en: Could you please call him into the meeting?
zh: 请您叫他来开会好吗？

en: My stomach started growling right there in the meeting. It was embarrassing.
zh: 就在会议上，我的肚子开始咕咕叫，太尴尬了。

en: Please let me know immediately if you would like to set up an area of the conference room for your products.
zh: 如果您想在会议室里为您的产品设置一个区域，请立即告诉我。

en: The meeting room is downstairs.
zh: 会议室在楼下。

en: The conference is to be held in Tokyo.
zh: 会议将在东京举行。

en: We adjourned the meeting for lunch.
zh: 我们休会吃午饭。

en: How do you account for your absence from the meeting?
zh: 你如何解释你缺席会议？

en: We'll resume the meeting after tea.

zh: 我感到很紧张。

en: I could not speak a word, for my heart was full.
zh: 我一句话也说不出来，因为我心里充满了感情。

en: I had an angina attack.
zh: 我得了心绞痛。

en: Enter by the narrow gate.
zh: 进窄门。

en: I made the best of my small room.
zh: 我充分利用了我狭小的房间。

en: A small road ran across the bridge, through the fields, and over a hill.
zh: 一条小路穿过桥，穿过田野，越过一座小山。

en: Two fat men trying to pass through a narrow doorway are in checkmate.
zh: 两个胖子试图穿过一个狭窄的门口，结果进退两难。

en: I am confused by your frenzied behaviour.
zh: 我对你疯狂的行为感到困惑。

en: Look out for the wild dog!
zh: 小心野狗！

en: It is no use trying to separate the sheep from the goats while in a state of madness.
zh: 在疯狂的状态下试图区分绵羊和山羊是没有用的。

en: Are you mad?
zh: 你疯了吗？

en: Mr. Hashimoto is fair to us.
zh: 桥本先生对我们很公平。

en: Mr Hashimoto was confused by Ken's question.
zh: 桥本先生被健的问题搞糊涂了。

en: Tom started the engine.
zh: 汤姆启动了引擎。

en: Mr Hashimoto is known to everyone.
zh: 桥本先生是众所周知的。

en: As he crossed the bridge, he looked down at the stream.
zh: 当他过桥时，他向下看着小溪。

en: I'll go with you as far as the bridge.
zh: 我陪你到桥边。

en: Bridges are burning and chances are few.
zh: 桥梁正在燃烧，机会不多了。

en: The bridge is being repainted.
zh: 桥正在重新粉刷。

en: The bridge was carried away by the flood.
zh: 桥被洪水冲走了。

en: The bridge was washed away by the flood.
zh: 桥被洪水冲走了。

en: The bridge is made of stone.
zh: 这座桥是石头做的。

en: Some people look down on others because they have less money.
zh: 有些人因为别人钱少就看不起别人。

en: Don't ask for money.
zh: 不要伸手要钱。

en: Making money is his religion.
zh: 赚钱是他的信仰。

en: Health is better than wealth.
zh: 健康胜于财富。

en: I prefer silver rings to gold ones.
zh: 我喜欢银戒指胜过金戒指。

en: No money, no job, no friends. He was truly at loose ends.
zh: 没钱，没工作，没朋友。他真是走投无路了。

en: Money does not grow on trees.
zh: 钱不是从天上掉下来的。

en: I will give you the money tomorrow.
zh: 我明天会给你钱。

en: Money will make the pot boil.
zh: 钱能使鬼推磨。

en: Money comes and goes.
zh: 钱来来去去。

en: Gold is heavier than iron.
zh: 金比铁重。

en: Gold is more precious than iron.
zh: 金比铁更珍贵。

en: The gold was beaten into thin plates.
zh: 金子被打成薄片。

en: Money ruins many.
zh: 金钱会毁掉很多人。

en: Money is a good servant, but a bad master.
zh: 金钱是好的仆人，却是坏的主人。

en: Gold is far heavier than water.
zh: 金比水重得多。

en: The money was hidden beneath the floorboards.
zh: 钱藏在地板下面。

en: Gold is similar in color to brass.
zh: 金的颜色和黄铜相似。

en: I have little money.
zh: 我几乎没有钱。

en: I have a little money.
zh: 我有一点钱。

en: Was the money actually paid?
zh: 这笔钱真的支付了吗？

en: Ready money will away.
zh: 现钱容易花光。

en: Gold is heavier than silver.
zh: 金比银重。

en: Keep the money in a safe place.
zh: 把钱放在安全的地方。

en: I have no money, but I have dreams.
zh: 我没有钱，但我有梦想。
